greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime p such that (2n)*p +1 and (p-1)/(2n) are prime, or 0 if no such prime exists.
comment: With rare exceptions, a(3n-1)=0. a(2)=13, a(5)=31 and a(35)=211, all of which are of the form 6n+1. This is true for those 6317 n's which have a solutions less than 10^6. I have no proof! - _Robert G. Wilson v_
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jul 16 2003
ext: Edited and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 18 2003
